sa12.20:1.2: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta’s Grove in Śrāvastī.
sa12.20:2.1: 2. It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks,
sa12.20:2.2: “It’s good, monks, to rely on someone to hear the Dharma.
sa12.20:2.3: Junior monks are to support and serve the senior monks.
sa12.20:2.5: From time to time, a junior monk who supports and serves senior monks can hear the profound and subtle Dharma.
sa12.20:2.6: After hearing the profound Dharma, he’ll achieve two ways of being correct: Correctness of body and correctness of mind.
sa12.20:3.1: 3. “At that point, he’ll cultivate the awakening factor of mindfulness.
sa12.20:3.2: After cultivating the awakening factor of mindfulness, he’ll fulfill the awakening factor of mindfulness.
sa12.20:3.3: After fulfilling the awakening factor of mindfulness, he’ll discriminate qualities, discern qualities, and deliberate on qualities.
sa12.20:3.4: At that point, he’ll skillfully cultivate the awakening factor of discriminating qualities …
sa12.20:3.5: he’ll cultivate the fulfillment of the awakening factor of equanimity.”
sa12.20:4.1: 4. After the Buddha taught this sutra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.
